title: I used to play this game all the time.
body:
And now my match history is full of massive gaps in between games.

We all know the reasons as well.

Matchmaking is shit.

The meta has been in a really shitty spot.

And just the constant stupid balance changes, i can hardly pull the motivation to even open this game up any more.

Fix your shit riot, before you start just losing everyone.

replies.body: The lux and jinx changes on the PBE are really pushing me to the edge

Lol they wanted to give kat a 15 second ult at rank 3 but for obvious reasons was panned.

The balance team is a bunch of bonobos

It would actually really interest me, to know who is on the balance team, what their ranks are, how much they play, and what champions they play.

Some of the stuff they do is pretty smart. 
But some stuff is just plain weird.

like randomly giving Kat a 15 sec ult out of the blue.
I've seen one Rioter here on the boards admit they were currently bronze 3 and I just laughed

Theres nothing wrong with being in bronze.

Its possible to understand the game in a professional capacity, but not have the mechanics or reflexes to apply your knowledge properly in game.

There are professors in universities that have studied architecture all their life, and teach it to PHD students, and yet have never built a single building in their life.

TBH id rather have the game balanced by bronze players who understand the game, and play it all the time, than by Plat level players who hardly play and just balance from statistics alone.

If bronze players fully understood the game, then they wouldn't be bronze. And you're comparing two things that work differently from each other. You can study architecture for years through attending University and reading books the same way you could spend years reading League guides, but when it comes to the actual practical stuff, you can't just follow a step-by-step process you learned in architecture the same way you could in League. Because every League game is a unique experience, you always have to adapt. It's like if someone who had never played a game of LoL before in their life spent 6 months watching pro player streams and reading Mobafire guides, then they suddenly downloaded LoL and hopped straight into a game for the first time. You wouldn't expect them to just suddenly get fed and dominate the game, because it just doesn't work like that. Because League revolves around both **Mentality** and **Practicality**. 

But I guess almost everything involves both anyway , even architecture (Because someone who has studied it all their life and has worked on many projects would be able to teach students better then someone who has studied it their whole life but has never built a single building ever).

I must disagree with you when you say: if they fully understood the game, then they wouldn't be bronze.

Its very easy to know a lot of information, but be unable to apply it in a practical situation.
For example, someone might know they need to watch the map every few seconds. However in game, they always get so caught up in trying to farm, and poke, and last hit etc. that they forget to look at the map.

They might know the perfect formula for last hitting. But they just cant get the timing of Karthus's basic attacks right, and so keep missing minions.

They know they need to CC Katarina as soon as she ults, but when she does ult, they panic and miss or hit the wrong keys.

Knowing what to do, doesn't always mean you can do it in reality.

_____

Your example about someone who reads lots of guides, and then doesn't get fed, is exactly what I'm talking about.
They know exactly what to do, and how to do it, they probably know more than many Silver or Gold players who just instalock Riven every game and let the champ and their reflexes carry them. Yet they would still be bronze, because they don't have the skill to apply their knowledge, even though they know much more about the game.

Would you rather the game was balanced by the gold Riven player who doesn't know shit about the rest of the game, but has lots of practice with Riven? Or would you rather the game be balanced by someone who knew the game inside out, but lacked the physical skill to get out of bronze.

______


You say that someone who has studied architecture all their life and built many buildings would be able to teach better than someone who hasn't built any buildings. While I'm sure thats true much of the time, ist isn't always.

My example would be Stephen Hawking.
Im guessing that Stephen Hawking doesn't get the chance to do many practical experiments (for obvious reasons).
But even though he doesn't do the practical element of science, you cant say that he isn't a better scientist than most other people do can do experiments.

If he put his mind to it, Stephen Hawking would be very good at balancing league, he would understand the power spikes of certain champions, and how some champ's power spikes happen at convenient times (like dragon spawn), and so have a better impact on the game, while others happen at times where they cant make full use of it, and so aren't as strong.
He would understand all of the little details that can make or break the game, and how to adjust them.

But he would be In bronze 5, because obviously he wouldn't be able to play very well.

yeah in like season 2 maybe. it's been an alright game at best since season 3 and has just gone downhill from there.

just because it's popular doesn't mean it's good. there are a few reasons it's popular. firstly, it's free, so 14 year olds without a job don't have to pay money to play it. secondly, it's simple and easy to get into. thirdly, casuals have bad tastes in games.

So take a break. Your obviously super frustrated atm. That will be affecting your perception of the game. Take a 2-3 week break, play no league. You'd be surprised how much of a difference it makes. 

If you come back and it's more enjoyable, problem solved. If it's not, maybe it's time to move on. Games evolve and change over time. Sometimes into things you may not necessarily enjoy. 

Personally I'm pretty happy with the current meta and some small errors withstanding (Seriously who thought giving rengar cc immunity was a good idea. Like why) im fairly happy with the balancing. Not to mention there finally addressing some of the champs you haven't changed in years. But there has been times I didn't feel like that. I almost quit once, but after a couple of weeks I came back and enjoyed it a lot more. 

Take a break. See how you feel after that
